title: How coronavirus affects fashion students' graduation
description: Students expecting to show final collections this summer face an uncertain future amid Covid-19.

title: Why this doctor's phone is her coronavirus helpline
description: Junior doctor Lisa Linpower describes how vital her phone has been during the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Coronavirus: The tourists swapping lockdown for Sweden
description: Sweden's relaxed lockdown has attracted growing numbers of British and European tourists.

title: Olof Palme: Who killed Sweden's prime minister?
description: Olof Palme was shot dead on Sweden's busiest road in 1986. Now, prosecutors may know who killed him.

title: Coronavirus: Devon care homes were 'hit so quickly'
description: One boss describes seeing staff fall ill and residents die as the virus swept through his care homes.

title: 'My first collection failed, it was heartbreaking'
description: Luis Onofre's luxury shoes are sold worldwide, and Michelle Obama and Paris Hilton are fans.

title: How my carer saved me during lockdown
description: When Shannon fell ill with coronavirus, her carer Caroline took matters into her own hands.

title: A surprise lockdown apology from my ex
description: Have the long hours of isolation during coronavirus lockdown led people to reflect on failed relationships?

title: George Floyd unrest : What Trump states make of unrest
description: These are the areas that propelled the outsider to victory in 2016 - we ask them what they think of the protests.

title: George Floyd death: 'We have a pandemic of black people dying every day'
description: Two young organisers of the weekend's protests tell BBC theirs is the generation to bring real change.

title: Conor McGregor: UFC fighter announces retirement for third time
description: Conor McGregor says he has retired from fighting - for the third time in four years.

title: George Floyd death: People cannot be silent in the face of racism, says Nandy
description: Labour's Lisa Nandy supports young people attending protests but urges them to take precautions.

title: Naser missed four anti-doping tests rather than the three she claimed, says AIU
description: World 400m champion Salwa Eid Naser missed four anti-doping tests rather than the three she claimed, says the Athletics Integrity Unit.

title: George Floyd: London anti-racism protests leave 27 officers hurt
description: Protests in London have been largely peaceful but were marred by scuffles outside Downing Street.

title: Coronavirus: US-China virus row flares with senator's comments
description: Rick Scott tells the BBC, without evidence, China is trying to "slow down" vaccine development in the West.

title: BA 'dismissal threat' undermines talks, pilots' union Balpa says
description: The airline threatened to dismiss all its pilots and rehire them under new contracts, Balpa says.

title: Momma's advice and lost reputations - Tyson v Holyfield in a 'Greatest Fight'
description: The money was record breaking, the fight colossal and the upset huge when Evander Holyfield and Mike Tyson finally locked horns.

title: Watch: 50th anniversary of Banks' wonder save from Pele
description: BBC Sport looks back to Gordon Banks's incredible save to deny Pele during England's group game against Brazil at the 1970 World Cup - a save widely acclaimed as the greatest in World Cup history.

title: George Floyd: Huge protests against racism held across US
description: Major US cities see peaceful rallies on the 12th day of protests sparked by George Floyd's death.

title: Coronavirus: Places of worship to reopen for private prayer
description: Churches, mosques and synagogues have been closed in England since lockdown restrictions began.

title: Great white shark kills surfer off Australia's New South Wales
description: The surfer was brought back to the New South Wales beach by "heroic" boarders but died of his wounds.

title: Kelli-Leigh: Black soul singers can feel 'defeated' in the music industry
description: The dance singer says writers and singers aren't getting the attention they deserve.

title: Newspaper headlines: Relaxed Covid rules and Black Lives Matter march
description: Protests across the UK feature prominently on several of the front pages, plus new Covid-19 warnings.

title: Coronavirus: Hard-hit Brazil removes data amid rising death toll
description: The country will now only report numbers for the past 24 hours, no longer giving the cumulative data.

title: 'Billions of people' to feel virus economic impact
description: World Bank President David Malpass says billions of people will have their livelihoods affected.

title: The Last Dance: Michael Jordan series 'shines light' on professor's legacy
description: Susan van de Ven is a councillor in Cambridgeshire whose father was killed in Beirut in the 1980s.
